subs.text: June 2021

subs.text: June 10
@kvanh Oof.
@DonovanBond I don’t know what the odds are but I’d buy one in a heartbeat. Love my titanium Apple Watch.
@derekpcollins Did that work for you too?
@ianc14 @daringfireball Maybe take a break from Twitter.
@rileycran @cabel I seem to recall that was Jim Cameron. Great idea.
@emoryzanef But doesn’t AirPlay require the target to be the same resolution as the source? So if AirPlay from a MacBook to iMac you’ll just get a 13-inch display upscaled to 24?
@gte @marcoarment @UnderTheLoupe Wild.
@Boris You didn’t miss it.
@416ash @LibertyRPF Interesting! Are you sure it wasn’t a human? Did it announce itself as the Google Assistant?
@komocode @daringfireball Only for non-SSL traffic.
@jnack @daringfireball Yeah, it was just a bunch of little things sprinkled throughout, not a “let’s talk about AR” segment.
@zzanehip Thank you for making this. It is astonishingly fun and delightful and well-done.
We’re never going to hear the end of this from that damn snarky @CARROT_app.
@jtphil Newsweek is still around?
@danparsons This has nothing to do with Apple.
@gazbeirne Boo hiss, let’s file radars and try to get this fixed this summer.
@JacobProbasco Looks like right now, CloudFlare is the only partner, but I think Apple is leaving it open to add others.

@DonSqueak @benthompson No apology necessary. iOS 15b1’s translation from German to English was enough for me to get the gist. Pretty good, really:

https://t.co/hcYOgH9HNr
@nicolasfurno @Moitah @atpfm Unless you’re not at the top of the page. (But of course you can jump to top by tapping status bar.)
@gyokusai No, because the new Mail Privacy Protection will block those too.
June 9
@joelion Do Windows machines still blue screen? (Spoiler: yes.)
@hotdogsladies @fullerc And then I wanted a pair.
@ttam110 🤣
@russell By trying not to piss anyone off with the obvious truth.
@mpv @daringfireball No. They move too fast. All I knew is we’d talk WWDC.
June 8
@peternlewis Typo! Long day…
Best new icon. https://t.co/csxNtJOCSL
@stickista Thanks. My hat is off to the local, state, and national officials who’ve quickly gotten on board with these sweepstakes. They’re clearly having a big effect.

@benedictevans @eric_seufert My understanding is that it’s Safari only. The screenshot you posted suggests that the exception to “Safari only” is “unencrypted traffic”, so I guess anything that doesn’t use SSL would be redirected too. But very little traffic is unencrypted these days.
@JasonKAlmeida @reckless @stevesi @urbanstrata The iOS 14 privacy features aren’t possible otherwise, including on MacOS.
@stevesi @reckless @urbanstrata If you really think it’s just “malware” you’ve lost the thread.
@Techinterested1 No sign of that.
@ratkins Of course not.
@stevesi @reckless @urbanstrata Exactamundo.
@Intel_Steve @reckless Well then let them build it on Android and they’ll prosper.
@reckless @urbanstrata Nobody lives in a walled garden either. I said that these analogies break down easily.
@jonfortt @reckless I only posted this morning!
June 7
@fishmonkeyhat @daringfireball Did my other URL not work for you? Maybe it was US only. Fixed!

@urbanstrata @reckless That’s like saying people need to understand how Disney World works, rather than just know that they enjoy it.

“iPhone and iPads are computers you can’t mess up” is all they need to know.
@urbanstrata @reckless 1 billion devices sold?
@Intel_Steve @reckless Meaning third party app stores?

@CleatusFetus @reckless You can mess up your Mac with third party software too. Look at all the people seeing battery drain just by having Chrome’s background agent running:

https://t.co/2K6DwyYJCg
@joshfofer @reneritchie @viticci Correct. Mac and iPad for read/write, iOS for read.
@jterhorst @stroughtonsmith No, because Carbon was a big rich set of APIs that powered a lot of amazing apps. So Catalyst is nothing like Carbon.

@reckless Any of these analogies break down easily. But I think you discount how much of the reason people *want* an iPhone as their primary/only computer is *because* of the walls and gates, not despite them.
@stroughtonsmith Or maybe Catalyst was never more than a stopgap.

init(markdown:options:baseURL:)

Creates an attributed string from a Markdown-formatted string using the provided options.

👍 https://t.co/e4MofRLuIM
@Techinterested1 I highly doubt any compiler other than Swift is going to be possible in Swift Playgrounds.
@atlauren I honestly don’t know if they’re on by default, but the pref setting has been there for a while now. My favorite change in Safari ever.
@atlauren Safari has had favicons in tabs for years, perhaps partially driven by me.

For your pre-WWDC keynote enjoyment: 

https://t.co/0KqbJwwC59
June 6
@nargan I don’t like it either. It works best if you just type the time. Using the spinners is too fiddly.
@mgsiegler No opening credit sequence. HBO static fanfare and boom it starts. Genius.
June 5
@esconner Other than that, how’d you enjoy the play, Mrs. Lincoln?
@tuckerjj Did you try it?
@agraham999 @yatil @jamesthomson I agree. American culture leads to more great companies and more terrible companies. I’ll take that mix over a culture that leads to milquetoast companies.
@Mantia @rjonesy @__sanch__ Maybe you shouldn’t only count public takes on Twitter.
@amyhoy @jjrscott @daringfireball Present tense ending, not past tense ended.
@telcodud @yenlai @neilcybart @daringfireball @InsideOrchard My suggestion to you is to get bent.

Me: “Hey Siri, play Liz Phair’s ‘Soberish’.”

Siri: “I didn’t find Liz Phair’s ‘So British’ on Apple Music.”
@crewless @stroughtonsmith @daringfireball I’ll bet you’re fun at parties.

@jamesthomson It’s fine to push for full-time WFH. It’s undoubtedly smart for Apple to make more exceptions to allow WFH in specific cases.

This letter isn’t it.
@yatil @jamesthomson Perhaps that’s why so many European companies are tech leaders.
@macsimcon @PaulKirvan @jjrscott @daringfireball You’re wrong. Stop.
@steveriggins No, no empathy at all. WFH two days per week is an enormous change for Apple.
@jjrscott @jayjayyy369 @macsimcon @daringfireball Yes, that’s Apple’s slogan: “The Status Quo Company”.
@macsimcon @jjrscott @daringfireball There is no risk to the vaccinated.
@neilcybart @daringfireball @InsideOrchard There are a lot of recently leaked letters that express views that are not widespread within Apple.
@migueldeicaza 0% remote days to 40% remote days is a pretty big change.
@hotdogsladies And it doesn’t fuck around.
@hotdogsladies That movie goes down like a cold drink on a hot day. Every time.
@drwave @Oatmeal Yes.
@aboretto @daringfireball Do tell.
@mgsiegler It’s like they turned it in a game and if you practice hard and get lucky, you can watch a show or movie you want to see.
@Alticus @daringfireball It wasn’t?
@jjrscott @daringfireball It wasn’t an apocalypse. It was a pandemic and it’s ending.
@stroughtonsmith @daringfireball Building a business where I can work from home wasn’t easy. Also: I have no teammates.
June 4
@mgsiegler @JoannaStern Ventress style. https://t.co/WQ0JXj57T6
@AlexMcCollister @daytonlowell @siracusa @thetalkshow 🙏
@tnkgrl @ASUS @HotHardware Battery life is definitely the weak spot for iPhone 12 Mini, but it’s a *lot* smaller.
